div.p: SilkTest is a tool for functional and regression testing, allowing you to create easy-to-maintain and fast-executing test automation across a broad range of technologies to identify quality problems early on in the development life-cycle.
You must install SilkTest in your Windows or Linux environment.
More information can be found at SilkTest.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin calls the SilkTest tool via command line and passes the user-provided parameters.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin allows the proper testing of programs.

ElectricFlow itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes, combo buttons, historical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of the log been generated, among others.
This plugin was developed and tested with SilkTest version 2010R2.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.

tr.td: Working Directory
Provide the directory where the Silk file resides. (Required)
Silk File
Provide a silk file, which can be a script, suite, testplan, or link file. (Required)
Arguments
If checked, this indicates that the Silk file has arguments.
Test Arguments
Define arguments for the Silk test.
File Directory
Indicate the directory where the Silk file is located. Leave blank to use the default directory.
Target Machine
Specify the target machine. The default is the current machine.
Project
Provide an optional argument specifying the project file or archived project to load when starting SilkTest.
Base
Indicate the directory where the project will be unpacked.
Query
Provide the name of a saved query.
Log File
Specify the file where you want SilkTest to log compilation errors.
Additional Options
Provide any additional options for the Silk command.
Results File
If checked, this indicates that you want a .res file where the test results will be written.

ul.li: Plugin converted into the new maven format.
